channel.title: BBC News - Europe
channel.description: The latest stories from the Europe section of the BBC News web site.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Balcony kisses seal royal wedding
item.description: Prince William and his newly titled bride the Duchess of Cambridge kiss on the balcony of Buckingham Palace, as more than a million people descend on central London for the occasion.

item.title: Germany arrests al-Qaeda suspects
item.description: German police arrest three suspected al-Qaeda members who officials say posed a "concrete and imminent" threat.

item.title: John Paul II's coffin brought out
item.description: The Vatican removes Pope John Paul II's coffin from its crypt in St Peter's Basilica ahead of Sunday's beatification ceremony.

item.title: French football 'had race quota'
item.description: France's football federation is to hold an internal inquiry into claims its officials backed a secret racial quota for trainees.

item.title: Europeans killed in Marrakesh blast
item.description: Morocco launches an investigation into a bomb attack on a cafe in central Marrakesh, with Europeans reportedly among 14 people killed.

item.title: 'Many dead' in south Russia siege
item.description: Russian security forces report killing a top Islamist militant and nine of his followers in a siege in the southern region of Stavropol.

item.title: Famed Swiss climber dies in fall
item.description: Swiss climber Erhard Loretan, who reached the summits of all 14 mountain peaks above 8,000m (26,247ft), dies in a fall in the Swiss Alps.

item.title: France ex-minister wins arms case
item.description: A French appeals court quashes the conviction of ex-Interior Minister Charles Pasqua for arms trafficking to Angola.

item.title: Russia space agency boss replaced
item.description: Anatoly Perminov steps down as head of Russia's space agency after a humiliating rocket failure in December.

item.title: Spanish jobless level rises again
item.description: Unemployment in Spain, already the highest in the EU, rises to a 14-year high, with 4.9 million people out of work.

item.title: Eurozone inflation rises to 2.8%
item.description: The eurozone's inflation rate has edged up to to 2.8% in April from March's figure of 2.7%, according to official data.

item.title: Russia ups rates as prices rise
item.description: Russia raises interest rates for the second time in 2011 as it battles to control inflation.

item.title: Dutch club 'signs up' hat-trick toddler
item.description: A Dutch football club awards a toddler a symbolic 10-year contract after watching him score a hat trick into his toy box on YouTube.

item.title: Hunt begins for Mona Lisa model
item.description: Researchers in Italy begin a search for the tomb of a woman who may have been the model for Leonardo Da Vinci's painting Mona Lisa.

item.title: Spyker profits fall on Saab woes
item.description: Dutch carmaker Spyker Cars, troubled owner of Saab, announces a net loss of 72m euros ($106m; £64m) for the first quarter.

item.title: Daimler reveals strong profits
item.description: German luxury car maker Daimler has unveiled a first-quarter net profit of 1.18bn euros, boosted by strong sales in China.

item.title: Real & Barcelona complain to Uefa
item.description: Real Madrid and Barcelona will complain to Uefa about each other's actions during their fiery Champions League match.

item.title: Uefa fines Rangers and bans fans
item.description: Uefa fines Rangers 40,000 euros and bans its fans from one away match following discriminatory chanting in a match at PSV Eindhoven.

item.title: VIDEO: European Parliament
item.description: The EU has been urged to give greater priority to expansion into the western Balkans, during a special inter-parliamentary session on 13 April 2011.

item.title: Monaco
item.description: An overview of Monaco including key facts, political leaders and notes on the media

item.title: San Marino
item.description: An overview of San Marino including key facts, political leaders and notes on the media

item.title: Abkhazia
item.description: An overview of Abkhazia including key facts, political leaders and notes on the media.

item.title: Ajaria
item.description: An overview of Ajaria including key facts, political leaders and notes on the media

item.title: Ceuta, Melilla
item.description: A profile of the Spanish north African enclaves of Ceuta and Melilla

item.title: Channel Islands
item.description: An overview of the Channel Islands including key facts, political leaders and notes on the media

item.title: Corsica
item.description: An overview of Corsica including key facts and notes on the media

item.description: An overview of the Faroe Islands including key facts, political leaders and notes on the media

item.title: Gibraltar
item.description: An overview of Gibraltar including key facts, political leaders and notes on the media

item.title: Isle of Man
item.description: An overview of the Isle of Man including key facts, political leaders and notes on the media

item.title: Kabardino-Balkaria
item.description: A profile of the southern Russian republic

item.title: Kosovo
item.description: An overview of Kosovo including key facts, leaders and notes on the media

item.title: South Ossetia
item.description: An overview of South Ossetia, including key facts and political leaders

item.title: Trans-Dniester
item.description: An overview of the breakaway region in eastern Moldova

item.title: VIDEO: The search for the real Mona Lisa
item.description: A team of researchers is using a special radar device at a convent in Florence where they think the body of the woman, called Lisa Gherardini, is buried

item.title: VIDEO: Royal fans from around the world
item.description: People from across the world have been camping along the route of the royal wedding procession, in the hope of catching a glimpse of the happy couple on Friday.

item.title: VIDEO: Italy to France: A migrant's journey
item.description: Many North African migrants who want to get into France start their journey in Ventimiglia, in northern Italy.

item.title: AUDIO: Diana's dress designer on 'divine' Kate
item.description: Kate Middleton is already a byword for style and glamour. David Emanuel, who made Diana Spencer's wedding dress in 1981, describes the soon-to-be Princess as 'divine.'

item.title: VIDEO: Ash cloud payouts still not made
item.description: A year ago this week, flights started returning to normal after the ash cloud from a volcano in Iceland forced the closure of much of northern Europe's air space.

item.title: VIDEO: Tests performed at 'Mars on Earth'
item.description: Scientists test new technology that may take us one step closer to a manned mission to Mars.

item.title: VIDEO: Wedding fervour in Kate's village
item.description: With four days to go Kate Middleton's home village of Bucklebury prepares for the royal wedding.

item.title: VIDEO: Pope calls for peace in Easter blessing
item.description: The Pope urges diplomacy and dialogue to bring an end to the conflict in Libya in his traditional Easter Sunday blessing.

item.title: Doors thrown open
item.description: Germany expects surge of Poles into job market

item.title: New approach
item.description: Will Russia ever reduce dependence on oil and gas?

item.title: 'Blessed' John Paul
item.description: What does it take to get fast-tracked to sainthood?

item.title: Going underground
item.description: Russia digs deeper in hunt for precious diamonds

item.title: Repressive state
item.description: How far will human rights feature in EU-Turkmenistan trade ties?

item.title: Bun fight
item.description: Now Russia and Ukraine fall out over fairy tales

item.title: In pictures
item.description: Translating tweets into cartoons in the UK
